name: overindulgence
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
behaviour in which you allow yourself to have too much of something enjoyable, especially food or drink: For many Americans, Thanksgiving is a time of overindulgence. Overindulgence in food and drink is a big danger for those who live alone.
behaviour in which you allow someone to have more of something enjoyable than is good for them: Her father thought he had to be mean, to counteract her mother's overindulgence. The school sees the result of parental interference and overindulgence all the time.
More examplesFewer examplesHer illness comes from overindulgence in drink and spicy foods.I am prone to overindulgence: If I sit down to watch a movie, I eat the whole bag of popcorn in five minutes. His book suffers from a reporter's overindulgence in detail. He criticised them for overindulgence toward their grandchildren. He has serious misgivings about the overindulgence of pets.Overindulgence of the young was kept firmly in check.
